casebody.data:
ALBERT GILBERT, Plaintiff and Respondent, v. EDWARD B. WESLEY, Defendant and Appellant. Appeal from a judgment entered upon the report of a referee, in favor of plaintiff in an action "brought to recover $10,000, for the services of plaintiff in procuring and effecting the sale of the Brick Church property in New York.

*572Before Barbour, Ch. J., Curtis and Sedgwick, JJ.

Decided April 5, 1873. Henry B. Knox, for appellant. E. C. Benedict, for respondent. Judgment affirmed.

Opinion by Barbour, Ch. J. Curtis and Sedgwick, JJ., concurred.
